text.div:
Generated Narrative: CodeSystem codesystem-missing-dicom-terminology

This case-sensitive code system http://hl7.eu/fhir/imaging-r4/CodeSystem/codesystem-missing-dicom-terminology provides a fragment that includes following codes in a Is-A hierarchy:

LvlCodeDisplayDefinition
1elements DICOM ElementsDICOM Element definitions
2  00080016 SOP Class UIDUniquely identifies the SOP Class.
2  00080018 SOP Instance UIDUniquely identifies the SOP Instance.
2  00080060 ModalityType of device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the Instances in this Series.
2  00083010 Irradiation Event UIDIrradiation Event UID
2  00181000 Device Serial NumberDevice Serial Number
2  00181002 Device UIDUnique identifier of the equipment.
2  00181008 Manufacturer Device Class UIDManufacturer Device Class UID
2  0020000D Study Instance UIDUnique identifier for the Study.
2  0020000E Series Instance UIDUnique identifier of the Series.
2  00080050 Accession NumberA departmental Information System generated number that identifies the Imaging Service Request.
2  0040A171 Observation UIDUnique identifier for the observation Content Item (and its subsidiary Content Items, if any). The UID represents the semantic content of the observation; an encoding of the same observation with the same context into another representation (e.g., a CDA Entry) may use the same UID.
2  00400554 Specimen UIDUnique identifier for the Specimen.
2  00620021 Tracking UIDA unique identifier used for tracking a finding or feature, potentially across multiple reporting objects, over time.

name: MissingDicomTerminology
title: Missing DICOM Terminology
description: Code system for codes that are defined in DICOM but for which no matching code system is available in FHIR.

concept.definition: Type of device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the Instances in this Series.
A departmental Information System generated number that identifies the Imaging Service Request.

Unique identifier for the observation Content Item (and its subsidiary Content Items, if any). The UID represents the semantic content of the observation; an encoding of the same observation with the same context into another representation (e.g., a CDA Entry) may use the same UID.
A unique identifier used for tracking a finding or feature, potentially across multiple reporting objects, over time.
